pages.text: Mineshafts are large underground systems of corridors with wooden plank pillars. They have a center room with a $(l:blocks/dirt)dirt$() floor, from which the corridors originate. Mineshafts are generally large and can also intersect each other.$(br2)Like most structures, they have different biome variants.

In a Mineshaft, you will find many ores waiting for you. If you need some $(l:redstone/rail)rails$(), you will find plenty of them here as well. Sometimes, even a $(l:redstone/minecart)chest minecart$() can be found, containing precious loot.$(br2)The bigger challenge, however, is getting rid of the monsters, especially the $(l:mobs/spider)cave spiders$() that sometimes have $(l:blocks/cobweb)cobweb$()-covered $(l:blocks/spawner)spawner$() hideouts here.
